item.title: MAGA survey
item.description:
How did (or did not) the Trump administration Make America Great Again?

The manifesto of the Trump administration has been “Make America Great Again.” Looking back the past four years, we asked the US citizens1 how they think the manifesto has been accomplished.


Questions

Q1. How did (or did not) the Trump administration Make America Great Again?
Q2. Did you vote for Donald Trump in the 2016 and/or 2020 elections?

Results

Negative opinions (54 posts)
  • Trump did not make America great again. I think he divided the country more than any President in my lifetime.
    64 likes
  • They did not. They brought strife and mistrust to America in ways never seen before. They nearly brought democracy to a shattering end.
    60 likes
  • The "law and order" president tried to skirt the laws and create mass chaos and disorder.
    55 likes
  • He did not make America great, he made it worse. He Is the worst President we ever had.
    50 likes
  • Trump made America worse and not great again. He delayed closing of market and it led to many covid19 related deaths.
    47 likes
  • Trump and the Trump Administration was self-serving and did not uphold the integrity and respect of holding office. The lies and deceitful nature of the whole administration is so disappointing.
    46 likes
  • He tried to play the presidency like his game show. Sometimes it was a big joke to him.
    36 likes
  • Trash president. Trash human being.
    35 likes
  • Trump disrespected many people and undermined democracy. He is responsible for the death of many hundreds of thousands of people. America may never be the same after this divisive administration.
    35 likes
  • He sabotaged every American except the rich. #OnePercentPresident
    33 likes
  • He has and still continues to take away the rights of people who do not fit into the heteronormative.
    32 likes
  • I'm worried he's sown a seed of sedition that will drive millions of white nationalists to start a second civil war.
    31 likes
  • None of jobs he promised to bring back actually came back.
    28 likes
  • Trump was never fit to hold white house in the first place
    28 likes
  • He was an embarrassment to the entire country. He led an attack on his own country's capital. That says enough right there.
    28 likes
  • The Trump Admin was the worst admin ever in this country.
    28 likes
  • Trump did not handle the pandemic well and the US is an embarrassment now
    25 likes
  • The rich got richer and the poor got poorer, business as usual.
    25 likes
  • Trump did not make America great again because he divided the country. He also cost Americans their lives.
    25 likes
  • President trump had some mistakes during covid beginning stages
    24 likes
Positive opinions (42 posts)
  • He fought for the people ignored by mainstream media and represented some conservative values. The left is socialist, racist, and accepting of authoritarian values.
    18 likes
  • He had a pandemic thrown at him from the hateful left and China and he still managed to help the economy to the best of his ability.
    18 likes
  • He got rid of the individual mandate in Obama care that was harming so many.
    18 likes
  • He brought back jobs and made us Energy independent the first time that has occured.
    17 likes
  • Well, he brought the Middle East a little closer together. Who would have thought that a few years ago.
    16 likes
  • All of these options are against Trump. I do not know a lot of details, but I do know that he improved our relations with some countries and brought more production back to the USA which are both positives.
    16 likes
  • The tax cuts he passed put more money in working families pockets and the stock market went up creating a better retirement for many.
    16 likes
  • Trump's action may be undone in many areas over time. but win or lose,his legacy will endure in the federal courts where his conservative lifetime appointees will influence every aspect of American life for decades.
    14 likes
  • Trump did an excellent job he did several peace deals in the Middle East. He was one of the only presidents to not actively start a war, he brought many troops home.
    13 likes
  • He exposed the corrupt media and many politicians that are not working for the people.
    13 likes
  • he did try to make America great again.
    12 likes
  • He raised a dead economy from the grave, began building a wall that protected Americans from criminal illegals, brought jobs back to America, supported policies that help small businesses, and pushed through vaccine development in the midst of a pandemic.
    12 likes
  • Trump did an excellent job with the economy, combatting the CCP, peace deals, no new wars, dealing with corrupt international organization like the WHO, lowest unemployment, sensible immigration policies. Covid and corrupt democrats ruined everything in the end.
    11 likes
  • THE LAW WILL NOT CHANGED BUT PEOPLE SHOULD THINK AND BRING OUT THE RIGHT PERSON FOR THE WELFARE OF OUR NATION
    10 likes
  • He didn't send troops to war, had the lowest unemployment rate in 50 years, moved the embassy to Jerusalem, brought relative peace to the middle east
    7 likes
  • He created Space X and double down on space exploration.
    7 likes
  • Trump did an excellent job
    7 likes
  • Trump made America worse by exacerbating a global pandemic, lying to people, and attacking and discrediting scientists.
    5 likes
  • first president to be invited to north Korea
    5 likes
  • America has been made greater than ever the past four years. But that all ends tomorrow.
    5 likes

Tweet

Summary  
Period Jan. 19th – 21th, 2021
Num. of respondents 271
Num. of opinions 97
Num. of initial opinions 0
Platform MTurk (US residents)

  1. US residents, more precisely, according to the MTurk record. ↩

item.title: 2020 US Presidential Election (Oct.)
item.description:
This is a poll conducted after the last debate (Oct. 22nd) for 2020 US Presidential Election.

What is the most important issue to you personally in the upcoming election?

Summary  
Period Oct. 26th – 30th, 2020
Num. of respondents 278
Num. of opinions 177
Num. of initial opinions 0
Platform MTurk (US residents)


Response patterns

Circular palette diagram

Linear palette diagram

The above circular/linear palette diagrams show the response pattern of each respondent; the respondents are aligned azimuthally/horizontally, and their response patterns are shown radially/vertically. The color of the most dominant group is indicated at the center of the circular palette diagram. (See here for more details about the palette diagrams).

Technical details

  • The data has been collected through Aska1, which generates a graph (network) as a result of a poll.
  • Opinions are classified into groups using graph clustering based on the response patterns2.
  • The group labels (i.e., coding) are determined by us, based on the classified opinion texts.
  • No annotation has been performed in the present analysis. That’s why we have groups of overlapped contents (Economy and COVID-19 & Economy) and there are few misclassified opinions.


Opinions in each opinion group

Popular opinions in each group are listed below.

Healthcare (25 posts)
  • The most important to me is letting the president do his job. Parties working together. Accepting the results! Not destroying cities when you don't get your way.
    17 likes
  • Some sort of health care reform to make it more affordable.
    14 likes
  • The most important issue is access to affordable healthcare
    13 likes
  • Healthcare is the most important issue in the upcoming election. I have a pre-existing condition, a daughter who is covered under my policy but is now 23 years old and I have concern for siblings, family members and friends.
    13 likes
  • Healthcare reform and access
    13 likes
  • Universal healthcare.
    13 likes
  • Protecting health care and the affordable care act
    12 likes
  • Change the president and change America
    11 likes
  • climate change
    10 likes
  • Improving basic human rights issues like health, nourishment, housing, and education.
    10 likes
Economy (5 posts)
  • Reopening and stabilizing the economy. Getting employment numbers back up.
    12 likes
  • I SUPPORT ALL THE RESPONSES FIRST THE PEOPLE AND THE ECONOMY HAS TO BE OPEN NORMAL AND MORE JOBS HERE IN FLORIDA THE MINIMUN WAGE
    5 likes
  • The most important issue in the upcoming election is the economy.
    4 likes
  • Income Inequality
    0 likes
  • My most important issue is the current economy.
    0 likes
COVID-19 & Economy (75 posts)
  • Covid-19 Relief
    38 likes
  • Economy
    33 likes
  • Covid-19 measures.
    30 likes
  • The most important issue to me is re-opening the economy and getting back to our normal lives.
    23 likes
  • bringing back the economy to what it was pre covid-19
    21 likes
  • Our healthcare and for those with pre-existing conditions
    19 likes
  • Healthcare coverage for all Americans to help us through the pandemic and beyond.
    19 likes
  • Coronavirus crises
    19 likes
  • Solve Covid and preventing further sickness.
    19 likes
  • Preserving the rights of the individual.
    18 likes
Racial equality (11 posts)
  • Racial equality
    18 likes
  • Reduce the taxes
    9 likes
  • Social justice issues
    7 likes
  • ANY PARTY WILL BUT THE MAIN THING IS THE WORLD BECAME NORMAL
    4 likes
  • criminal justice reform, specifically being more lenient on laws and prevent prison overcrowding
    4 likes
  • Stopping the race-baiting and division of the population
    4 likes
  • Equality. Justice. A president who doesn't give handouts but also had a heart
    4 likes
  • Decency, ending racism and bringing the country together.
    3 likes
  • Violence in the streets.
    1 likes
  • Some one with a moral compass.
    1 likes
Climate change, Women's rights, etc. (61 posts)
  • The corruption and lawlessness of the current administration.
    15 likes
  • Immigration
    15 likes
  • Hunger, homelessness, and affordable housing
    11 likes
  • Climate change solutions, not denials
    11 likes
  • Women's rights/pro-choice
    10 likes
  • abortion and reproductive rights
    10 likes
  • covid and harm reduction from conservatives
    10 likes
  • Equal rights for women
    9 likes
  • Corruption actually being addressed and nepotism laws being enforced. The fact that Trump has funneled millions into his own businesses and contacts at the tax payers expense is out of line and He should have sold off Mar-a-lag
    9 likes
  • Climate change.
    9 likes

  1. We renamed our graph-based survey framework to Aska from voteclustering. ↩

  2. You might have noticed that the opinion graph is too sparse to detect these groups. Actually, we have collected more than 278 responses (but with a slightly different setting) and we used those extra information behind to achieve this resolution. ↩

item.title: COVID-19 vaccine
item.description:
Are people actually willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine if it were available?

Would you get a COVID-19 vaccine if it were available to you today?

Summary  
Period Sep. 24th, 2020
Num. of respondents 415
Num. of opinions 235
Num. of initial opinions 0
Platform MTurk (US residents)


Response patterns

The above palette diagram shows the response pattern of each respondent (respondents are aligned horizontally, their response patterns are shown vertically).

  • Roughly 20% of proposed opinions are not exactly the responses to the question asked (coded as Not directly related to vaccine). We kept those opinions because there are considerable amount of respondents who reacted to them. We also obtained a few opinions that can’t be coded clearly, although they are related to the vaccine (Unknown). We neglect the green and orange portions of the diagram hereafter.

  • Overall, most of the people are positive about taking the vaccine (if it were available), although not so many people are willing to take it as soon as possible. [Yes and Yes, if it is ensured to be safe]

  • However, a considerable number of respondents support No and Wait for a while.

  • Some people are skeptical about political influence (Political influences).

  • All of these opinions have emerged spontaneously from the respondents.


Opinions in each opinion group

Popular opinions in each group are listed below.

Concern about political influences (7 posts)
  • As long as Trump is in office, nothing can be trusted to be safe.
    13 likes
  • I'm very concerned about a vaccine being approved strictly for political purposes and then being given to the public without sufficient trials. If proper procedure is followed, however, I'll get that vaccine as soon as it's available.
    11 likes
  • I would never get a vaccine that is approved by USA entities while Trump is still president. I would wait for him to leave the office and THEN I can trust the US institutions again.
    10 likes
  • I will NOT take the vaccine if Donald Trump says it’s o.k. but no other credible people (like Dr. Fauci) agree.
    10 likes
  • I am afraid of taking the vaccine, because of different rumors going around about the vaccine.
    9 likes
  • I would like to know the vaccine development is free from political influence and was put through the standard research and trials as all vaccine are. Only then would I consider getting myself and my family vaccinated.
    7 likes
  • I will not get any Vaccine rammed through by the Trump administration in order to get him re-elected.
    3 likes
Yes (41 posts)
  • I would get it to prevent spread
    22 likes
  • Absolutely, I want the vaccine as soon as possible.
    22 likes
  • Yes.I would get it.
    21 likes
  • I am eagerly waiting for covid 9 vaccine. Covid 19 is a dangerous virus for all of us. I think vaccine helps us to get rid from Covid19.
    20 likes
  • I would get a COVID vaccine, assuming I would not experience negative long-term side effects, but irrespective of the efficacy
    20 likes
  • I would take asap
    19 likes
  • I pray each and every time to find the vaccine for this deadly virus. I would be willing to get the vaccine and ensure all people in the world will afford and access it.
    19 likes
  • I would take it.
    19 likes
No (19 posts)
  • I will not take the Covid-19 vaccine.
    13 likes
  • covid-19 has a disastrous one. this was stunned by the world. lot of people suffered and get more anexious. once find the suitable vaccine we will so much happy.also the safety of the vaccine is a big question. we will find a suitable one against covid-19
    11 likes
  • I'm aware of a previous vaccine that was rushed out and had disastrous results for some.
    10 likes
  • No, I wouldn't. The vaccine would not have been tested for long enough to know it is safe.
    10 likes
  • No. You have to pay for the vaccine and pay me at least $500.
    10 likes
  • What’s really in the vaccine? What are long term effects? How effective is it? What are the side effects or negative things that could happen?
    9 likes
  • No. I would not get the vaccine
    9 likes
  • We need another stimulus check !
    9 likes
Wait for a while (23 posts)
  • There is very low risk of me contracting Covid in my small, rural town. I am healthy, so there is very low risk of a Covid infection negatively impacting my health. I will wait a year or two until it has been proven safe and effective in real world use.
    19 likes
  • I would consider it, but only after it has been proven safe. It would take a while to study the vaccine to know it's safety.
    19 likes
  • I would wait a little bit until the vaccine has been out to make sure everything goes okay, then once it has been proven effective I would get it.
    18 likes
  • I'd want to know long term side effects - a year or more down the line - before I made a decision.
    18 likes
  • I would get the vaccine, but would not be one of the first to do so. I would want to wait to make sure that it is safe.
    17 likes
  • I would wait until I am sure the vaccine is safe and effective, that is others have taken it and are okay. I won't be first in line.
    16 likes
  • I will probably wait a little while, but not too long. Just long enough to get a sense that it is safe.
    16 likes
  • I would want to get the vaccine, but wait to see the side effects and until it has been out a while.
    16 likes
Unknown (17 posts)
  • It depends on the scientific data and consensus backing the efficacy and more importantly, safety of the vaccine.
    55 likes
  • I will believe health practitioner if they are the one who recognized it for the masses
    44 likes
  • Even with a vaccine, still continue practicing good and healthy hygiene habits.
    22 likes
  • use properly very safe it
    21 likes
  • Its welcome stuff., but i dont really think i need it. At least not for now. Am still yet to trust new vaccines like this
    21 likes
  • I will get the vaccine once it has been tests using the proper methods and trials AND when I’m assured that its approval has not been influenced by politics, money, etc.
    17 likes
  • let the WHO test it
    16 likes
  • If Mr president support it I accept it
    15 likes
Yes, if it is ensured to be safe (49 posts)
  • I will get the vaccine as soon as there is one available that is proven to be effective and safe. Until then, keep wearing masks and maintaining distance.
    29 likes
  • I would get it if it is proven to be safe. I think it is patriotic and everyone's responsibility to help stop the spread of the virus.
    26 likes
  • I will get it after it has cleared all clinical trials and it has been extensively tested.
    25 likes
  • Once the studies are completed and the vaccine[s] is/are verified as safe, I will get it/them as quickly as I can.
    25 likes
  • I would get the vaccine if it is proven safe. I am high risk and want to be protected.
    24 likes
  • Everyone would as long as it is safe
    24 likes
  • Yes, as long as it is proven reasonably safe I would eventually get it.
    23 likes
  • I would be willing to get the COVID-19 vaccine if it was proven safe. But I believe it will be rushed to appease the public and ease tensions.
    23 likes
Not directly related to vaccine (59 posts)
  • were mask when ever you go outside
    23 likes
  • it is the main area we could know our strength
    23 likes
  • i am just waiting to go for out and just want to talk people freely
    22 likes
  • i was stunned foe each and keep distance and i use mask avoid the covid 19 in cautious and safe themselved
    22 likes
  • Most people have no idea how #vaccines go from idea to syringe. What questions do you have about vaccine development?
    21 likes
  • Covid 19 very dangerous disease
    21 likes
  • the very thinking and good all the people is very sad
    20 likes
  • good think about the pandemic situation
    20 likes

item.title: 2020 US Presidential Election (Sep.)
item.description:
The first Presidential Debate for 2020 US Presidential Election took place on Sep. 29th.

What is the most important issue to you personally in the upcoming election?

Using our open-ened survey system, we have conducted a poll from Sep. 30th to Oct. 2nd. We recruited 881 respondents through Amazon Mechanical Turk 1.


Response patterns

In this poll, we identified three statistically distinct respondents groups 2. Each row in the above table represents an opinion group and each column represents a respondent group. The value in a cell is the fraction (in percentage) of “Likes,” which is normalized within each column. You can find the list of actual opinion texts at the bottom of this post.

The fractions of Economy and Healthcare are high in every respondent group. We found several other topics and categorized them as the opinion groups 3; many of them are related to recent unprecedented events such as COVID-19, wildfire, Black lives matter issues, and death of Ruth Bader Ginsburg. The three respondent groups have different response patterns for these topics.

It is evident that respondent group B is characterized by Support Biden, Never Trump. In contrast, we can hardly conclude that groups A and C are Trump supporters. The fact that the fractions of Support Trump are 5.2% and 2.3% in these groups indicates that this is not their major issue; note that this result does not implies that there are not so many Trump supporters or Joe Biden is in the lead. The population of each respondent group is shown below.

Population of the respondent groups

The acutal opinion texts of each category are listed below. Among 144 independent opinions 4, we only show few of them that earned many “Likes.”

"Kindness"
  • Love and unity
    27 likes
  • Be kind.
    27 likes
  • Kindness, compassion, and decency. I'd like for there to be more important things to the administration than their own power and income.
    23 likes
"Climate change"
  • Taking action on climate change
    67 likes
  • Pass laws that address climate change by reducing the use of fossil fuels and encouraging the use of alternative energy sources
    61 likes
  • Climate Change
    56 likes
"Other responses"
  • eliminating world wide corruption
    90 likes
  • Basic human decency.
    64 likes
  • No new wars, reigning in the riots, removing anti-white and anti-American propaganda from schools ending all COVID lockdowns/stay at home orders, stopping Democrat politicians from imposing open-ended unconstitutional limitations on American citizens.
    45 likes
  • Review and rewrite outdated laws and their process.
    30 likes
  • We have had Democratic presidents and Republican presidents. The country always survives no matter who is in power.
    28 likes
"COVID-19"
  • COVID-19 GOING TO DO THE ALL EFFECTS IN ELECTION. WE NEED TO WAIT AND SEE IT
    110 likes
  • The COIVD virus. Slowing the spread and saving lives. And the economy
    98 likes
  • How covid 19 influences job market.
    97 likes
"Support Biden/Never Trump"
  • Having a functional adult in office
    75 likes
  • Biden earned a reputation for being a "drug warrior", leading efforts in the war on drugs
    65 likes
  • Who else believes that Donald tRump is a narcissist?
    64 likes
  • Getting sanity and professionalism back into the White House and leading our country once again
    63 likes
  • I support Biden for president.
    62 likes
"Healthcare"
  • I want to see healthcare become more affordable and that is available to everyone. No person should go bankrupt because of healthcare bills.
    84 likes
  • Universal Healthcare
    71 likes
  • Medicare for all
    70 likes
"Economy"
  • Universal Basic Income so people can breathe and stop living paycheck to paycheck in fear that if 1 little thing happens you lose it all
    63 likes
  • Economy and jobs
    55 likes
  • Protect the working middle class
    55 likes
  • Student debt crisis.
    54 likes
"Black lives matter"
  • Stopping police murders and brutality toward Black people
    44 likes
  • Stopping environmental racism
    43 likes
  • Electing people who will respect our constitution and the values that REALLY make our nation great, instead of the bigotry and hatred espoused by white supremacists.
    43 likes
  • I think race issues are the biggest problem right now. It's become ridiculous all these people protesting, rioting, etc over two people who were involved in criminal activity.
    40 likes
"Aptitude as the president"
  • Taking a step back and seeing the destruction of mankind in its self by the very ones who think they are upholding good values for the nation
    51 likes
  • Bringing people into office who prioritize what is best for the nation as a whole, instead of just an elite few.
    41 likes
  • I believe that the president should be able to lead the nation out of hardship.
    41 likes
"Violence"
  • Safety for myself and family.
    83 likes
  • right wing violence
    79 likes
  • Violence in America
    75 likes
"Support Trump"
  • I want to see our country continue in the right direction and love on the people inside it’s borders
    28 likes
  • Trump 2020
    26 likes
  • I support Trump for president.
    26 likes
"LGBT rights"
  • Keeping and expanding on the rights for LGBT+ people, please do not take away my right to marry.
    88 likes
  • Rights and protections for LGBT+ individuals, stopping the epidemic of violence against trans people
    76 likes
"Women's rights"
  • Women's rights and their right to choose, keep abortion safe and legal.
    79 likes
  • Overturning Roe v. Wade
    75 likes
  • Women's reproductive rights (easier and more affordable access to feminine hygiene products, revised abortion laws, etc.)
    72 likes
"Democracy"
  • Saving our democracy.
    65 likes
  • Protect, preserve and expand where needed any and all issues which would threaten DEMOCRACY and each and every citizen's rights within said Democracy.
    59 likes
"Immigration"
  • Abolishing ICE and ensuring safe asylum for refugees and others
    54 likes
  • 10 year moratorium on legal immigration
    53 likes
  • illegal immigration
    51 likes
"Fascism"
  • Respecting Law and Order, denouncing ANTIFA
    54 likes
  • Stopping America's descent into fascism
    46 likes
"2nd amendment"
  • 2nd amendment
    67 likes
  • 2nd amendment AND 1ST ADMENDMENT!!!!
    59 likes
  • Defending the right to keep and bear arms.
    49 likes

  1. Disclaimer: The results here may not be accurate. Moreover, it is possible that the results presented here may be update in the future. ↩

  2. There is no initially prepared opinions in this poll. ↩

  3. We put annotations on most of the opinions, and utilized them in graph clustering. ↩

  4. We have excluded invalid opinions. ↩

item.title: 2016 US Presidential Election
item.description:
This is a survey that we conducted 4 years ago for the US presidential election. Most of the responses were collected at the site of Presidential Debate (University of Nevada).

Q: #NeverHillary or #NeverTrump ?

Group A (featured)
  • Hillary Clinton doesn't care about BlackLives She only cares about BlackVotes
    27 likes
  • At this moment I think both of them have many problem with conducting the country
    21 likes
  • She’s a criminal． She does not deserve to hold office． Trump just has a loud mouth． Hillary will destroy the country．
    17 likes
  • She's a liar and should buy Glennbeck's new book
    12 likes
  • Hillary is a liar． Period
    8 likes
  • I believe that both are incapable of running this country．
    6 likes
  • Hillary should go to jail．
    5 likes
  • There are faults from both, but my thinking leans towards Trump． Mainly due to his ideals of guiding leadership．
    5 likes
  • Calling millions of Americans a basket of deplorables is frightening, hearing this makes her Negroponte endorsement make sense．
    4 likes
Group B (featured)
  • Hillary has such an impressive history of working for us all!
    45 likes
  • ImWithHer because she cared enough to prepare． She's smart． Ready． And passionate about details because they matter．
    32 likes
  • She believes America is already great and will improve it even more!
    10 likes
  • Trump would be a disaster to the Japan-Us alliance．
    10 likes
  • Hillary, because she's got unparalleled leadership and political experience． She's able to take a stand but can also compromise．
    5 likes
  • I'm with her because she is the most pro-science and intellectual candidate．
    5 likes
  • Only one choice． I can't believe Trump．
    4 likes
  • Hillary knows how it works．
    4 likes
  • I feel America needs a leader that believes in America and its dream
    4 likes
Group C (featured)
  • Donald Trump is a sham． He is only interested in his own popularity and power, and is a sexist, racist liar．
    26 likes
  • ImWithHer because she cared enough to prepare． She's smart． Ready． And passionate about details because they matter．
    24 likes
  • I am against Trump because he doesn't seem to have the emotional stability required from someone that can launch nuclear weapons．
    19 likes
  • I am not a HillaryClinton fan, but I hope she's okay．
    18 likes
  • I think he doesn't have the minimal level of knowledge required to be capable of running a country．
    11 likes
  • Trump repeatedly claimed he has "a foolproof way of winning the war with ISIS．" How many will have to die before he shares it?
    10 likes
  • NeverTrump bc public persona of cruelty and predatory business practices, and a campaign conjuring xenophobia to answer with empty slogans．
    10 likes
  • America can't be compromised by leaders with conflicting loyalties．
    9 likes
  • Never Trump Or Hillary!Neither are trustworthy or capable of transparent presidency promoting peace prosperity & freedom．Im W/ Gary Johnson．
    4 likes
  • I'm not with her． I feel the bern． But we are stronger together
    4 likes
  • I believe we need to break out of a two-party election．
    4 likes

* Opinions with less than 4 likes are omitted.

Methods

  • Clustering algorithm : EM algorithm based on the labeled stochastic block model
